definition: extreme sorrow turns to joy (idiom)
to negate/to deny/not
clogged/evil
extremely/pole (geography, physics)/utmost/top
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
safe/peaceful/most/grand
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next

sentences.english: The darkest hour is that before the dawn.
sentences.chinese: 黎明之前是最黑暗的时刻，否极泰来。

sentences.english: but don't forget the times your luck has turned.
sentences.chinese: 但不要健忘你否极泰来的时辰。

sentences.english: You should also consider refinancing if your credit score or financial situation improves.
sentences.chinese: 你也应该考虑如果你的信用得分或财务融资否极泰来。

sentences.english: When you encounter unfortunate, think of fortunes.
sentences.chinese: 当你遇到不幸时，想着否极泰来。

sentences.english: And the voice is telling me that things have changed a lot.
sentences.chinese: 这声音告诉我一切已不一样了，即指否极泰来。

sentences.english: A good bhe darkest hour is that before the dawn.
sentences.chinese: 黎明之前是最黑暗的时刻，否极泰来。

definition: when things reach an extreme, they can only move in the opposite direction (idiom)
bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: without destruction there can be no construction
fortunes rise and fall/times change
the time comes, fortune turns (idiom); to have a lucky break/things change for the better
one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: the road to happiness is strewn with setbacks (idiom)
extreme joy turns to sorrow (idiom); Don't celebrate too soon, things could still go wrong!
to come back from death's door (idiom); unexpected rescue from danger/fig. to recover from a seemingly impossible situation/to find a way out of a predicament
to come true/to come about as predicted/to be fulfilled
lit. the old man lost his horse, but it all turned out for the best (idiom)/fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to lose at sunrise but gain at sunset (idiom)/to compensate later for one's earlier loss/what you lose on the swings you gain on the roundabouts
pinyin: shi1 zhi1 dong1 yu2 , shou1 zhi1 sang1 yu2

definition: lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
lit. the willow trees make the shade, the flowers give the light (idiom); at one's darkest hour, a glimmer of hope/light at the end of the tunnel
